body: More and more businesses are using open data, from large corporations to startups. When starting a business with open data, it is important to design your business model and consider how open data will underpin that model. In this module we explore open data business models.
displayTitle: Starting a business with open data
title: Starting a business with open data

_skills.outcome: Explain the importance of a value proposition
List the elements of the business model canvas

body: Open data isn't just useful for startups looking to innovate with data, it is also a crucial source to grow and develop your business. A business grows by increasing sales or by increasing its profitability and open data can support both of these activities.
displayTitle: Growing a business with open data
title: Growing a business with open data

body:
Opening data can be a valuable activity for any organisation. Whether to drive innovation in the business, develop a clearer picture of operations or improve products and services, a growing number of private and public sector organisations now benefit from publishing and using open data.

This module will prepare you to deliver a tailored pitch for open data that highlights value and addresses risks.
title: Pitching for open data

_skills.outcome: Structure an elevator pitch for an open data business
Describe how to tailor an open data pitch to different audiences

body: Open data is a relatively new concept. Any change will bring barriers - challenges for some current ways of working, or barriers for those who want to use open data but can't. In this module, we explore how to overcome technical and non-technical barriers to open data use in established businesses.
title: Overcoming barriers for established businesses

_skills.outcome: Explain the importance of collaborating with stakeholders for an open data project
Identify different types of open data stakeholders
